programme.title: POV
programme.desc: An Indigenous painter returns home and learns why his ancestors' stories cannot be forgotten.

programme.desc: Examine compelling, real life stories and features with political leaders with Steve Adubato.

programme.title: Think Tank With Steve Adubato

programme.title: Longevity Paradox With Steven Gundry, Md
programme.desc: Dr. Gundry shares an easy approach to help us all feel better and more youthful, at any age.

programme.title: Ancient Remedies With Dr. Josh Axe
programme.desc: Dr. Axe's goal is to empower people to find wellness in their own lives by focusing on the powerful benefits of using food to heal your body; an approach rooted in an age-old practice but tailored to our modern world.

programme.title: John Sebastian Presents: Folk Rewind
programme.desc: Folk legend John Sebastian reflects and remembers the very best of the Folk Years.

programme.title: Wine First
programme.desc: Liora and Yolanda travel to beautiful Austria in search of three local Styrian wines to present to chef Harald Irka for the cooking challenge.

programme.title: Kevin Belton's Cookin' Louisiana
programme.desc: Delicious recipes include fried quail with peach chutney, Louisiana catfish with okra and corn and peach cake with vanilla whipped cream and cane drizzle.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Mexican food and culture from the beloved Pati, who brings her kitchen to yours.

programme.title: Sara's Weeknight Meals
programme.desc: Great recipes include Korean barbecue tacos, spaghetti squash with a creamy goat cheese sauce and dried fruit potstickers.

programme.title: NJ Business Beat With Rhonda Schaffler
programme.desc: Rhonda Schaffler sits down with labor market experts to discuss how New Jersey's workforce is changing - from companies no longer demanding college degree requirements to workers using their newfound leverage to find better jobs.

programme.title: Reporters Roundtable With David Cruz
programme.desc: David Cruz talks with Assembly Minority Leader Jon Bramnick and a panel of reporters about the latest headlines on the Governor's race results and other top stories making news in the Garden State and the nation.

programme.title: Chat Box With David Cruz
programme.desc: From the polls to the so-called 'enthusiasm gap' by the Democrats, David Cruz discusses what happened in this week's surprise election with Ashley Koning, John Froonjian, Senator Loretta Weinberg and Bill Palatucci.

programme.title: NYC Arts
programme.desc: NYC-Arts provide arts lovers in the tri-state area with an all-access pass to the arts.

programme.title: State of the Arts

programme.title: This Old House
programme.desc: Kevin, Tom, and Charlie install a five-layer Flitch beam. Jenn watches a tree company attach a cable on an old Hemlock for support and then prune an overgrown Crabapple tree. Tom and Charlie prepare for a footing to support the corner chimney.

programme.title: Ask This Old House
programme.desc: Mark explains how bricks are made and how many different varieties there are; Richard explains how solderless connections work; Tom assess and reshingles a shed roof with asphalt shingles.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Penny and Steven visit and announce that when they retire, they will live in Spain.

programme.title: Upstart Crow
programme.desc: William Shakespeare tries to make a name for himself while balancing work and family.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Neville is left perplexed when a lottery winner is found dead but her body then disappears. JP has an unruly new officer to train whilst preparing for the birth of his twins.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Miss Marple
programme.desc: Agatha Christie's unassuming amateur sleuth solving a series of murders.

programme.title: Orchard House: Home of Little Women
programme.desc: The 350-year-old home in Concord, Massachusetts where Little Women was written is highlighted. Orchard House uniquely inspired Louisa May Alcott to write the beloved novel at a desk in her room that her father made especially for her.

programme.title: Masterpiece Classic
programme.desc: Two love stories, 60 years apart, chart the changes and challenges in gay lives in England — from the era of jail terms to the onset of dating apps.

programme.title: To Be Announced
